title: [Large-Scale] OEP-Based Microlearning Course for High School Open Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital device proficiency and foundational social studies knowledge
context.additional_context: Open Educational Practices (OEP) in smartphone-limited tech environments, offering flexible learner pathways through integration of formal/informal learning to design learner-driven social studies experiences

learning_goals: Learners can complete at least two microlearning projects that solve real-life social studies problems using open platforms.
Learners can co-design learning pathways with peers and external experts and incorporate iterative feedback at each stage.

Learners will create a learning portfolio connecting formal and informal learning activities (e.g., online lectures, field training) linked to vocational training by utilizing three or more mobile-based open educational resources (OERs) and submit outcomes meeting four or more of the five institutional evaluation checklist criteria.

resources: Access to OER (Open Educational Resources) databases
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
